definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
various genera of flowers of Asteracea family (daisies and chrysanthemums), including Atractylis lancea

sentences.english: Waiting in line for a chance at the operating table.
sentences.chinese: 排隊等待着上手術檯的機會。

sentences.english: They fixed up a simple operation table at one end of the room.
sentences.chinese: 他們在房間一頭搭了一張簡易手術檯。

sentences.english: If possible, please do not strap my arms to the table during the procedure.
sentences.chinese: 如果有可能，請不要把我的胳膊捆上手術檯上。

sentences.english: I was in the middle of an operation that lasted six hours.
sentences.chinese: 我在持續了六個小時的手術檯中間。

sentences.english: On the operating table lay a 50-year-old man, dying from heart failure.
sentences.chinese: 手術檯上躺着一位因爲心臟衰竭而垂死的50歲男人。

sentences.english: By the time my friend got there, his son had died on the operating table.
sentences.chinese: 當我朋友趕到醫院時，他的兒子已經死在手術檯上。

sentences.english: Hannah was operated on a week later.
sentences.chinese: 確診一週後，漢娜上了手術檯。

sentences.english: They set up an operating tcapable in a tiny temple.
sentences.chinese: 她們將手術檯架設在一座小廟裏。

sentences.english: Additionally, standard operating tables and imaging equipment are not suited for obese patients.
sentences.chinese: 另外，標準手術檯和影像設備也不適合肥胖病人。

sentences.english: General surgery is graduate beyond the examination room of young army is on operating-table.
sentences.chinese: 普外科畢業生餘仔軍的考場就在手術檯上。
